definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Breathe out through pursed lips as if you were whistling.
sentences.chinese: 从闭合嘴唇中呼气，就好像在吹口哨。

sentences.english: The youth imagined he was out of sorts, and set to whistling softly.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子以为他情绪不好，就轻轻吹起了口哨。

sentences.english: The farmer whistled as the cow milked .
sentences.chinese: 牛产奶时，那位农民吹着口哨。

sentences.english: A: Can you whistle tunes while you do it, like Elise can?
sentences.chinese: 你能不能在那样做的同时用口哨吹歌，像爱丽斯一样？

sentences.english: He whistled as he sauntered along the street.
sentences.chinese: 他吹着口哨，悠然地沿着街道漫步。

sentences.english: The musician is whistling a tune merrily.
sentences.chinese: 我们班有六位同学用口哨合吹了一首曲子。

sentences.english: He gave a loud whistle of surprise.
sentences.chinese: 他吹了一声响亮的口哨表示惊讶。

sentences.english: She walks across a levee, blowing a whistle and waving her arms.
sentences.chinese: 她在大堤上走来走去，吹口哨，挥舞着胳膊赶鸟。

sentences.english: When they needed a refill, they used the whistle to get some service.
sentences.chinese: 当他们要新来一杯时，就用吹吹口哨叫服务生。

sentences.english: The dog heard his master's whistle and broke into a run.
sentences.chinese: 这条狗听到他主人的口哨声，就蓦地开始跑起来。

sentences.english: A few minutes later they heard a long low whistle.
sentences.chinese: 几分钟后他们听见一阵冗长而低沉的口哨声。

sentences.english: Barbary whistled a Ronssllon fisherman 's song .
sentences.chinese: 巴伯里用口哨吹一支罗士兰渔民歌曲。

sentences.english: Troy stepped forward and whistled a double note.
sentences.chinese: 托伊迈步向前，用口哨吹了一个双音。

definition: failed/busted/to have not succeeded/to have died/to have parted company/to have chilled (of a relationship)
to whistle (with fingers in one's mouth)/nowadays written 呼哨
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
